20101209181259.824|20101209181300.412|CCO|    
20101209181300.412|20101209181301.000|CCO|    or stroke may increase.
20101209181301.000|20101209181301.588|CCO|  People with stomach ulcers or
20101209181301.588|20101209181302.176|CCO|
20101209181302.176|20101209181302.765|CCO|  conditions that cause bleeding
20101209181302.765|20101209181303.353|CCO|    
20101209181303.353|20101209181303.941|CCO|      should not use PLAVIX.
20101209181303.941|20101209181304.529|CCO|    
20101209181304.529|20101209181305.118|CCO|        Taking PLAVIX alone
20101209181305.118|20101209181305.706|CCO|
20101209181305.706|20101209181306.294|CCO|  or with some other medicines,
20101209181306.294|20101209181306.882|CCO|    
20101209181306.882|20101209181307.471|CCO|          including aspirin,
20101209181307.471|20101209181308.059|CCO|
20101209181308.059|20101209181308.647|CCO|    may increase bleeding risk,
20101209181308.647|20101209181309.235|CCO|    
20101209181309.235|20101209181309.824|CCO|        so tell your doctor

20101209181310.412|20101209181311.000|CCO|      when planning surgery.
20101209181311.000|20101209181311.909|CCO|        
20101209181311.909|20101209181312.818|CCO|        Tell your doctor
20101209181312.818|20101209181313.727|CCO|    
20101209181313.727|20101209181314.636|CCO|    all medicines you take,
20101209181314.636|20101209181315.545|CCO|  including aspirin, especially
20101209181315.545|20101209181316.455|CCO|    
20101209181316.455|20101209181317.364|CCO|    if you've had a stroke.
20101209181317.364|20101209181318.273|CCO|  If fever, unexplained weakness

20101209184757.000|20101209184759.000|CCO|TO CREATE A MATERIAL THAT ACTED 
20101209184759.000|20101209184801.000|CCO|LIKE OUR BODY DOES TO DAMAGE.

20101209184818.143|20101209184819.571|CCO|>> LET'S TALK ABOUT THIS 
20101209184819.571|20101209184821.000|CCO|MATERIAL THAT YOU'VE DEVELOPED.

20101209184822.667|20101209184824.333|CCO|VIDEO OF THIS THING.
20101209184824.333|20101209184826.000|CCO|I WANT THE VIEWERS TO 
20101209184826.000|20101209184827.667|CCO|UNDERSTAND, THERE'S ALREADY A 
20101209184827.667|20101209184829.333|CCO|RIP IN THIS MATERIAL.
20101209184829.333|20101209184831.000|CCO|IT'S NOT A RIP, BUT THAT'S THE 
20101209184831.000|20101209184832.429|CCO|WAY IT'S SUPPOSED TO BE.
20101209184832.429|20101209184833.857|CCO|IT KEEPS REPEATING ITSELF.
20101209184833.857|20101209184835.286|CCO|THE WAY YOU SEE IT NOW IN THE 
20101209184835.286|20101209184836.714|CCO|BLUE IS THE WAY IT IS IN ITS 
20101209184836.714|20101209184838.143|CCO|NORMAL STATE.
20101209184838.143|20101209184839.571|CCO|WATCH WHAT HAPPENS.
20101209184839.571|20101209184841.000|CCO|YOU'LL SEE THE RIP COME, AND 
20101209184841.000|20101209184842.429|CCO|THEN YOU'LL SEE -- THERE YOU GO.
20101209184842.429|20101209184843.857|CCO|YOU SEE THAT RIP.
20101209184843.857|20101209184845.286|CCO|SEE HOW IT RIPS ON THE RIGHT 
20101209184845.286|20101209184846.714|CCO|SIDE OF THE SCREEN AND THEN 
20101209184846.714|20101209184848.143|CCO|HEALS ITSELF.
20101209184848.143|20101209184849.571|CCO|EXPLAIN TO ME HOW THIS WORKS.
20101209184849.571|20101209184851.000|CCO|>> WHAT WE'RE DOING IS USING A 
20101209184851.000|20101209184852.667|CCO|FIBER OPTIC NETWORK.
20101209184852.667|20101209184854.333|CCO|AND THIS FIBER OPTIC NETWORK IS 
20101209184854.333|20101209184856.000|CCO|DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT THE 
20101209184856.000|20101209184857.667|CCO|MATERIAL.
20101209184857.667|20101209184859.333|CCO|AS THIS CRACK PROPAGATES THROUGH
20101209184859.333|20101209184901.000|CCO|THE POLYMER IN THIS CASE, A 
20101209184901.000|20101209184902.667|CCO|SHAPED MEMORY POLYMER, AS IT 
20101209184902.667|20101209184904.333|CCO|PROPAGATES THROUGH THE POLYMER, 
20101209184904.333|20101209184906.000|CCO|IT FRACTURES THE FIBER OPTIC.
20101209184906.000|20101209184907.667|CCO|THAT SIGNALS THE DAMAGE IS IN 
20101209184907.667|20101209184909.333|CCO|THE STRUCTURE.
20101209184909.333|20101209184911.000|CCO|THAT FRACTURED LOCATION ACTUALLY
20101209184911.000|20101209184913.000|CCO|PROVIDES US A MECHANISM TO 
20101209184913.000|20101209184915.000|CCO|DELIVER PHOTO THERMAL ENERGY, 
20101209184915.000|20101209184917.000|CCO|WHICH IS THE LIGHT LEAKING OUT 
20101209184917.000|20101209184919.000|CCO|OF THE FIBER OPTIC DIRECTLY INTO
20101209184919.000|20101209184921.000|CCO|THE MATERIAL.
20101209184921.000|20101209184922.429|CCO|THIS CAUSES A LOCAL HEATING.
20101209184922.429|20101209184923.857|CCO|AND SO THIS POLYMER HAS THE 
20101209184923.857|20101209184925.286|CCO|ABILITY TO REMEMBER ITS ORIGINAL
20101209184925.286|20101209184926.714|CCO|SHAPE.
20101209184926.714|20101209184928.143|CCO|AND SO AS THIS CRACK MOVES 
20101209184928.143|20101209184929.571|CCO|THROUGH, IT'S DEFORMING THE 
20101209184929.571|20101209184931.000|CCO|MATERIAL.
20101209184931.000|20101209184932.667|CCO|AND ONCE WE APPLY THIS 
20101209184932.667|20101209184934.333|CCO|PHOTOTHERMAL ENERGY AND HEAT THE
20101209184934.333|20101209184936.000|CCO|MATERIAL LOCALLY, IT CAUSES IT 
20101209184936.000|20101209184937.667|CCO|TO REVERT BACK TO ITS ORIGINAL 
20101209184937.667|20101209184939.333|CCO|SHAPE.
20101209184939.333|20101209184941.000|CCO|AND SO THIS HEALING MECHANISM IS
20101209184941.000|20101209184942.667|CCO|INHERENT TO THAT MATERIAL.
20101209184942.667|20101209184944.333|CCO|AND AS WE ELEVATE ITS 
20101209184944.333|20101209184946.000|CCO|TEMPERATURE, IT ACTUALLY BRINGS 
20101209184946.000|20101209184947.667|CCO|IT BACK AND RETURNS IT TO ITS 
20101209184947.667|20101209184949.333|CCO|ORIGINAL CONFIGURATION.
20101209184949.333|20101209184951.000|CCO|WHAT YOU SEE IN THAT IMAGE IS 
20101209184951.000|20101209184953.000|CCO|THE DAMAGED STRUCTURE, THIS 
20101209184953.000|20101209184955.000|CCO|CRACK, AND US HEATING IT AND IT 
20101209184955.000|20101209184957.000|CCO|ACTUALLY RECOVERING.
20101209184957.000|20101209184959.000|CCO|WHEN IT'S THAT ENTIRE PURPLE

20101209185001.000|20101209185002.000|CCO|RECOVERED 100% OF ITS ORIGINAL 
20101209185002.000|20101209185003.000|CCO|SHAPE.
20101209185003.000|20101209185004.000|CCO|>> WHAT IS THAT?
